description.plain:
Beach Bunny is a Chicago-based indie pop band founded by Lili Trifilio in 2015. Initially Trifilio’s solo project and stage name, she expanded the project to a full four-piece band in 2017, featuring Matt Henkels (guitar), Jonathan Alvarado (drums), and Aidan Cada (bass). This lineup performs both live and on studio recordings. Aidan Cada would be replaced by Anthony Vaccaro in 2019.

In their own words, Beach Bunny is best described as “sad surf honey tries to ride the biggest wave in the Midwest”.

The project has released a total of five EPs and two full-length albums. The first two EPs, Animalism and Pool Party, were solo acoustic releases by Trifilio, recorded at home on acoustic guitar and ukulele. The third EP Crybaby featured drums added by Trifilio’s friend Ryan Adams, and shortly after this release, the project was expanded to a full band.

Beach Bunny saw their greatest success beginning with their fourth EP Prom Queen, with its title track becoming a viral trend on TikTok. After signing to Mom + Pop Music in October 2019, the band’s first full-length album, Honeymoon, followed on Valentine’s Day 2020. In November 2020, the band released a new single titled “Good Girls (Don’t Get Used)”, and announced their fifth EP, Blame Game, which was released in January 2021.

In October 2021, the band released the single “Oxygen”. This was followed by the single “Fire Escape” in March 2022, along with the announcement of their sophomore album Emotional Creature, releasing in July 2022. Three more singles were released leading up to the album – “Karaoke”, “Entropy”, and “Weeds” – with music videos that formed a sci-fi trilogy conceptualized and written by Trifilio.

songs.title: Prom Queen

description.plain:
Prom Queen is the title song from Beach Bunny’s EP “Prom Queen”. The song was initially released in 2018, but rose to popularity from the popular video app TikTok in 2020.

The song itself is the inner monologue of a girl struggling to accept herself for who she is; it follows the girl as she changes herself to fit the societal ideal of beauty.

The message of this song is to remind the listener (who is most likely a young woman, seeing as Beach Bunny’s genre is self-proclaimed “sad-girl” music) to not change themselves to get people to like them and to learn to be happy with who they are on the inside, because the relationships they form from being beautifully, uniquely, and totally herself will be more rewarding and they will feel more “okay”.

songs.embed_content: Read “Prom Queen” by Beach Bunny on Genius

songs.lyrics:
88 ContributorsProm Queen Lyrics[Verse 1]
Shut up, count your calories
I never look good in mom jeans
Wish I was like you
Blue-eyed blondie, perfect body

[Chorus 1]
Maybe I should try harder
You should lower your expectations
I'm no Quick-Curl Barbie
I was never cut out for Prom Queen

[Post-Chorus]
If I get more pretty, do you think he will like me?

[Verse 2]
Dissect my insecurities
I'm a defect surgical project
It's getting hard to breathe
There's plastic wrap in my cheeks

[Chorus 2]
Maybe I should try harder
You should lower your beauty standards
I'm no Quick-Curl Barbie
I was never cut out for Prom Queen
You might also like[Bridge]
If I'm pretty, will you like me?
They say beauty makes boys happy
I've been starving myself, carving
Skin until my bones are showing

[Outro]
Teach me how to be okay
I don't want to downplay my emotions
They say beauty is pain
You'll only be happy
If you look a certain way
I wanna be okay
I wanna be okay31Embed

songs.title: Cloud 9

description.plain:
“Cloud 9” is track nine on Beach Bunny’s debut album Honeymoon. It was released on January 10, 2020 as the album’s third single.

This is a giddy love song about an uplifting love interest. It describes the highs and initial euphoria of a relationship.

“Cloud 9” went viral on the social media platform TikTok as of March 2021. It charted in the US, Canada, Ireland, and the UK. It peaked at #9 on Billboard’s Bubbling Under Hot 100 Singles and #12 on Billboard’s Hot Rock & Alternative Songs. The success of the song ultimately led to a remix of the track featuring Tegan and Sara.

songs.lyrics:
29 ContributorsCloud 9 Lyrics[Verse 1]
I don't wanna seem the way I do
But I'm confident when I'm with you
Lately, all I feel is bad and bruised
Tired of tripping on my shoes

[Chorus]
But when he loves me, I feel like I'm floating
When he calls me pretty, I feel like somebody
Even when we fade eventually to nothing
You will always be my favorite form of loving

[Verse 2]
When I start to tumble from the sky
You remind me how to fly
Lately, I've been feeling not alive
But you bring me back to life

[Chorus]
But when he loves me, I feel like I'm floating
When he calls me pretty, I feel like somebody
Even when we fade eventually to nothing
You will always be my favorite form of loving

[Instrumental Bridge]
You might also like[Chorus]
But when he loves me, I feel like I'm floating
When he calls me pretty, I feel like somebody
Even when we fade eventually to nothing
You will always be my favorite form of loving15Embed

songs.title: Sports

description.plain: Sports is about being unsure in a relationship with another person. The singer wants to pursue a relationship with a love interest that seems ambivalent and unsure about what they want. This leads the singer to be frustrated and confused about the relationship. Beach Bunny presents a relatable juxtaposition between sports and love while she laments over being forced to play “games”–something that has exhausted her in life.

songs.lyrics:
37 ContributorsSports Lyrics[Verse 1]
If you feel lonely
I could be lonely with you
Tell me, baby
Why do you seem so blue?

[Pre-Chorus]
Why are we so complicated?
Maybe love is overrated

[Chorus]
I'm tired of waitin'
I was never good at sports
Save the games for the girls on the tennis court
Say you need me
But lately, you feel unsure
Come on to me, come on to me
I need more
(Ooh, ooh, ooh)

[Verse 2]
If you feel broken
Promise I won't break your heart
If you shatter
I won't let you fall apart
You might also like[Pre-Chorus]
Why are we so complicated?
Love's a word I've always hated

[Chorus]
I'm tired of waitin'
I was never good at sports
Save the games for the girls on the tennis court
Say you need me
But lately, you feel unsure
Come on to me, come on to me
I need more

[Outro]
It always feels like
I need more
Jesus Christ, you're so confusing
If we keep score
Bet my money that I'm losing21Embed
